question: Each State AG should as soon as the accounts of a month are closed, submit a monthly account of its transactions to the State Government in Form
The figures for this monthly account should be taken from the Consolidated Abstracts.
Any difference between the cash balance in treasuries and the balance shown in the Cash Balance Report should be worked out and explained on the face of the Account.

Progressive accounts incorporating adjustments made in the accounts for March Final and any Supplementary adjustments made after the close of those accounts should also be submitted to State Government

Annual Accounts including Appropriation Account a State is prepared by the State AG and submitted to the CAG for approval and transmission to the Governor of the State concerned under

The accounts of all the Governments in India on a common and comparable basis and are prepared mainly on the basis of the figures contained in the respective Finance Accounts of Governments concerned.

Part I-General Account-(i) a summary of Receipts and Disbursements of all Governments by sectional heads of account, and (ii) accounts of Receipts and Disbursements by Major Heads of Account of all Governments in the Revenue Account, Capital Account and all other sections
Part II-Subsidiary Account-The Subsidiary accounts give details, generally minor heads, of all the figures shown in the General Accounts relating to each type of Governmental activities

Buildings which are situated within the premises of jail, hospitals, police-lines, tehsils, educational institutions, provided that they are allotted rent-free to Govt. Servant
Buildings which are not intended to be used as regular residences such as Dak- bungalows, rest houses, circuit houses, inspection houses and other such buildings
Petty buildings the cost of which does not exceed Rs. 5,000 or any other limit which may be prescribed by Government

answer: Category of building for which Capital & Revenue A/c are maintained

question: Class II- Buildings from which the recovery of the full standard rent is not expected, that is, buildings which, will ordinarily be occupied by Govt. servants who are entitled to accommodation rent free or at reduced rents
Buildings should not ordinarily be transferred from 0ne class to the other unless there is a permanent change in the condition and should have effect from commencement of a financial year
The buildings should be brought on the capital and revenue account in the year following the year of their acquisition, construction, lease and if already in existence then first brought into use.
answer: If event takes place on 1st April, then same year

question: Transections relating to the capital cost and maintenance of sanitary, water supply and electric installation and fittings of a residence should be included in those for the building itself.
Transactions relating to other services such as garden, tennis court etc. for which additional rent is recovered should be shown separately below those relating to buildings
Furniture is treated as an item by itself and so furniture provided for all such residence in each circle superintendence or other unit is prepared separately.
Accounts of residential buildings are prepared on the basis of information furnished by the executive officer in Form
Both in respect of capital outlay and maintenance charges, the actual charges only should be taken and no additional charges on account of establishment, T&P etc.
If a building is occupied partly as a residence and partly as office, the best possible approximation for assessing capital value of residential portion shall be made in consultation with
answer: Superintendent Engineer or Other as Govt.

question: In the case of non-residential buildings which are converted into residences, if the original cost cannot be ascertained from the records, the Capital value should be based on the estimated value of the buildings
answer: Subject to rule made by Govt. in this regard
